thread.title: Thurston won’t be the next Immortal
thread.title_full: Thurston won’t be the next Immortal

title: Thurston won’t be the next Immortal
text:
Darren Lockyer next likely Immortal, Johnathan Thurston to wait until 2023 Dean Ritchie Exclusive The Daily Telegraph Darren Lockyer next likely Immortal, Johnathan Thurston to wait until 2023 Dean Ritchie Exclusive The Daily Telegraph Todd Carney to sue the Cronulla Sharks 0:33 
NRL: Former Shark Todd Carney prepares to sue Cronulla based on claims of unlawful dismissal after the release of lewd photos last year led to his contract being torn up October 13th 2015 /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/NRL/ 
NORTH Queensland superstar Johnathan Thurston will become an Immortal — but not until at least 2023. 
The Daily Telegraph understands an elite judging panel will convene early next year to determine whether a ninth Immortal should be inducted in 2016. 
It appears a formality with the two early favourites being legend Mal Meninga and his Queensland mate, Darren Lockyer, who is slight favourite. 
After his grand final heroics ten days ago, Thurston was being touted as the next Immortal, some even suggesting he will become the first still-playing star inducted. The Daily Telegraph can though reveal Thurston will have to be patient. 
He still has two years to run on his current Cowboys contract with judges remaining firm on a rule that prevents any player becoming an Immortal until at least five years after retirement. It means Thurston has a seven-year wait, at least. 
Around 15 former players will be considered next season — Lockyer, Meninga, Ron Coote, Mick Cronin, Laurie Daley, Brad Fittler, Ken Irvine, Brett Kenny, Allan Langer, Glenn Lazarus, Steve Mortimer, Norm Provan, Steve Rogers, Peter Sterling and Shane Webcke. Other Stories
